snippet: A populist Shiite leader, Moktada al-Sadr, expressed support on Tuesday for new protests against Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, a fellow Shiite but his political opponent.
abstract: Moktada al-Sadr, populist Shiite leader in Iraq, expresses support for protests against fellow Shiite and political opponent Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, saying that Maliki bears full responsibility for unrest in country; Sadr's remarks could indicate that he is testing political waters before Iraq's spring elections.

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: A populist Shiite leader, Moktada al-Sadr, expressed support on Tuesday for new protests against Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, a fellow Shiite but his political opponent.

headline.seo: Moktada al-Sadr Encourages Demonstrations in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Shiite Rival Encourages Protests Against President of Iraq
